channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Man identified, arrested after allegedly driving moving truck into LA crowd at anti-Iranian regime rally
item.description: Two people were injured when a U-Haul truck drove into a large crowd of demonstrators during an anti-Iranian regime protest in the Westwood neighborho...

item.title: Thousands of nurses go on strike at several major New York City hospitals
WATCH: Big wins, surprises highlight the 2026 Golden Globe Awards
item.description: ABC News contributor Kelley Carter reacts to the night’s biggest moments, including top prizes for “Hamnet” and “One Battle After Another” and the ris...

item.title: WATCH: Guide dog and vision-impaired owner are on a travel mission
item.description: ABC News' Danny New reports on two best pals who are turning heads at National Parks across the country -- one on two legs.

item.title: Allegiant Air to acquire Sun Country Airlines in $1.5B deal
item.description: Allegiant Air says it will acquire Sun Country Airlines in a cash-and-stock deal valued at about $1.5 billion

item.title: Breaking down Bob Weir's impact on music
item.description: Grateful Dead co-founder Bob Weir died last week at 78. Rolling Stone senior writer Angie Martoccio joins CBS News to discuss Weir's legacy.

item.title: Crowd yells ‘cowards!’ after federal agents crash into a car and fire tear gas in Minneapolis
item.description: Federal officers in Minneapolis have fired tear gas to break up a crowd of whistle-blowing bystanders who showed up to see the aftermath of a car cras...

item.title: George Floyd and Renee Good: 5 years between Minneapolis videos, and confusion has increased
Takeaways from interview with exiled Iranian Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi amid massive protests
item.description: Exiled Iranian Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi spoke with CBS News' Norah O'Donnell on Monday as deadly anti-government protests continue across Iran. CBS N...

item.title: DOJ probe into Powell sparks backlash from some Republicans, former Fed chairs
item.description: A bipartisan group of top economic officials called the DOJ probe into Jerome Powell an "unprecedented attempt" to undermine the Fed's independence.

item.title: Nurses strike begins in New York City as thousands walk off jobs
item.description: The largest nurses strike ever in New York City is underway as thousands of NYSNA members walk off their jobs at major hospitals.

item.title: Sen. Mark Kelly files lawsuit against Pete Hegseth

item.description: The Supreme Court will consider whether laws in Idaho and West Virginia banning transgender athletes from competing on girls' and women's sports teams...
